messages.title: A Brighter Future For Our Mental Health Services...
messages.content: The NHS may be the envy of the world, but our mental health service is not. People are struggling. When they turn for help, it is often not there. Waiting times for mental health services are, on average, 14 weeks - just for an assessment - before support and care can even begin. Problems that can start small, become crises as help is either not available, or arrives late. The Liberal Democrats have a plan to tackle this. They will have people to provide funding and investment into services. They will also ensure services run 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The Liberal Democrats will increase mental health staffing and will ensure that, by 2025, 100% of children and young people with diagnosable conditions get NHS treatment. Liberal Democrat Leader Jo Swinson said: 'For many years, mental health has been overlooked by Conservative and Labour governments. My government will ensure these patients no longer face shamefully long waiting times and are treated with the same care as those with physical illnesses. We will ensure our mental health services are there for everyone who needs them.'

messages.title: NHS Under Threat with Trump and Johnson
messages.content: If Boris Johnson remains as Prime Minister, things will only get worse for our NHS. Donald Trump has made it clear that the NHS would be part of negotiating any trade deals with the US. 'Poll reveals majority believe lying Boris Johnson will sell off NHS services to US.' Daily Mirror, October 2019

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase funding, services to run 24/7, increase staffing, ensure 100% of children and young people with diagnosable conditions get treatment by 2025.
